sense.name: ammunition
sense.commentary: unit of ammunition, one shot - a charge of ammunition or a single shot
sense.examples: John left the shooting range when he used all of his rounds. If you run out of rounds before the monster dies then the game is over. He emptied a round into the target.

sense.name: cycle
sense.commentary: ROUND[+event] rhythm, beat, daily round - an interval during which a recurring sequence of events occurs
sense.examples: John made his rounds to all the nearby vending machines each morning. The never-ending round of the seasons. The doctor's rounds begin every morning at 7:00. The postman's rounds take all day. We enjoyed our round of the local bars. In the old days a policeman walked rounds and knew all his people by name. The story is going the rounds in Washington. They'll be singing rounds in music class today.

sense.name: sports
sense.commentary: ROUND[+event] turn, bout - a period of play during a sporting event
sense.examples: The fourth period should be over before bedtime. That first period lasted way too long. She made a fantastic goal in the third period. John dropped his soda all over his lap in the first period. Fido sat beside John throughout the second period in hopes that he'd drop something else.

sense.name: golf
sense.commentary: ROUND[+event] round of golf - the activity of playing 18 holes of golf
sense.examples: A round of golf takes about 4 hours. This round of golf was especially short. Our round is supposed to begin at 7:00.

sense.name: servings(drinks)
sense.commentary: round of drinks - a serving to each of a group (usually alcoholic)
sense.examples: After the first round, John puked all over the bar. He ordered the second round. The first round is on me. A round on the house.

sense.name: meat
sense.commentary: a cut of beef between the rump and the lower leg
sense.examples: The round of beef had freezer burn. She'll serve the whole round for dinner, tonight.

sense.name: applause
sense.examples: There was a round of applause. C'mon folks, give us a round of applause. That round of applause could be heard all the way down the street.

sense.name: chair rung
sense.commentary: rung, stave - a crosspiece between the legs of a chair
sense.examples: She broke the chair round with her foot the other day. Mom will glue the round back together.

sense.name: circle
sense.examples: The machine punched out metal circles.
